Shaw","startTime":null,"eventDescription":"Becky Shaw & Allen Broyles perform an eclectic, rich variety of holiday songs that will warm your heart and bring you the true spirit of Christmas.  Order up some holiday hoo-ha from the Eddie’s Attic bar, maybe add some delicious gnosh, and have yourself a merry, early evening with friends and family!  The beautiful sounds of Becky’s voice and Allen’s ivories will be further enhanced by Lee Kennedy – bass – and Linda Bolley – drums & angelic harmonies, and … you never know who else might join them.  Hello, Christmas!

Becky Shaw & Allen Broyles 

Becky Shaw (Roxie Watson, Susi French Connection, Reversing Hour) and Allen Broyles (Josh Joplin Group, Susi French Connection, The Crafties) met in 1994, during the production of the studio recording, “Jesus Christ, Superstar: A Resurrection” featuring Amy Ray (Jesus) and Emily Saliers (Mary Magdalene), along with many Atlanta bands and musicians. During rehearsals & performances of the live production of JCS at the Variety Playhouse, SXSW and “The Pier” in Seattle, both came to respect each other’s musical talents.  But it was their experience working together in cover bands “The Cake Toppers” and “Susi French Connection” that gave Becky the idea to enlist Allen’s help in recording some Christmas songs with her in 2008.  What began as an idea to create some simple recordings of a few Christmas carols to give as gifts that year quickly evolved into something that sounded so great, they decided to do a second recording the following year and have begun work on a third.  “It’s been an epic project!”  

Since 2009, Becky and Allen have continued to work together in various music projects, most recently Becky’s first solo record, “Shut Down, Jump In,” released in January of this year, which Allen co-produced with Becky & Rob Gal.  But around the winter holidays, if the spirit moves them to dust off the holiday songs, you’re in for a special, fun evening of music.  Hello, Christmas!","isMobileFriendly":"false","image":{"jumbo":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atjmbo.jpg","width":884,"height":1238},"jumbo1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atjmbo1.jpg","width":960,"height":540},"large":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atlg.jpg","width":300,"height":420},"large1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atlg1.jpg","width":300,"height":200},"medium":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atmd.jpg","width":200,"height":280},"medium1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atmd1.jpg","width":200,"height":133},"original":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-og.jpg","width":884,"height":1238},"small":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atsm.jpg","width":100,"height":140},"small1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atsm1.jpg","width":100,"height":67},"square":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-sq.jpg","width":100,"height":100},"squareSmall":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-sqsm.jpg","width":60,"height":60},"xlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atxl.jpg","width":500,"height":700},"xlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atxl1.jpg","width":500,"height":334},"xxlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atxxl.jpg","width":650,"height":910},"xxlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/95/25/05-atxxl1.jpg","width":650,"height":433}},"youtubeVideos":[],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"","urlMySpace":"","urlFacebook":"","urlTwitter":"","twitterScreenName":""},{"id":1710571,"name":"DeDe Vogt","startTime":null,"eventDescription":"DEDE VOGT has earned a gold record for her work with The Indigo Girls and sings with a deep, husky voice that echoes with experience. She is responsible for helping to nurture the Atlanta music scene and has led the way for folk musicians for quite some time. As a multi-instrumentalist, her wide range of influences and provocative style help to create magic. “She has been my idol for so long, I used to sneak into her shows at The Harvest Moon Saloon when I was 16 and then I’d come home and try to play her songs. She is the backbone and then I’d come home and try to play her songs. She is the backbone of the acoustic scene.” – Michelle Malone

Years of constant touring/performing, beginning in 1969 in NY, California, South America, Seattle- NW and Europe, CAROLINE AIKEN moved back to her birth town of Atlanta, GA, in the late 70's, (opening for acts Arlo Guthrie, Muddy Waters, Doc Watson, Randy Newman, Bonnie Raitt, Little Feat, 38 Special, Beach Boys, Janis Ian, Richie Havens...), where her bluesy voice, masterful finger picking guitar style and hypnotizing stage presence anchored the city's acoustic and folk scene, influencing up and coming artists whom she took under her wing, including Indigo Girls and Shawn Mullins. 

Her unforgettable, one-of-a-kind voices, her deeply rooted in personal experience and storied songs, her masterful instrumentation on guitars and piano, the teaching of her Zen and The Art of Performance workshop nationally and internationally (also at the Otis Redding Songwriter Camp at the GMHF), her 12 years as Entertainment Director at the Atlanta Dogwood Festival and her 45 years of live performance and 8 self produced recordings create an experience that you can't shake, and won't want to. -Georgia Music Hall of Fame, 2011","isMobileFriendly":"false","image":null,"youtubeVideos":[],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"","urlMySpace":"","urlFacebook":"","urlTwitter":"","twitterScreenName":""},{"id":1376261,"name":"Sonia Tetlow","startTime":null,"eventDescription":"Multi-instrumentalist and songwriter, Sonia Tetlow, is know both as a side man and a front woman. She's currently the banjo player and one of the singers and songwriters in Atlanta Americana band, Roxie Watson, but you'll often find her sitting in with friends on an assortment of instruments. During the 2000's, she led the Atlanta rock bands Herman Put Down the Gun and STB. She also toured nationally as the bass player for Cowboy Mouth and the guitar and mandolin player for Paul Sanchez and the Rolling Road Show. 

While performing with different bands and artists, Sonia has continued to hone her craft as a songwriter and solo artist. Her latest record, A Place for Everyone (released in November 2014) was recorded half in New Orleans and half it Atlanta, and features guest appearances from both cities, including the Indigo Girls' Amy Ray, Bonerama's Craig Klein, Hannah Thomas, and Jamie Lynn Vessels. The 13 songs on the album showcase Sonia's own special blend of rock 'n roll and Americana with a New Orleans flair.

Other artists have begun to take notice of her songwriting as well. Sonia's songs have been performed and recorded by artists such as Bonerama, Glen David Andrews, Paul Sanchez, Cowboy Mouth, Jamie Vessels, and Arséne DeLay.

"I love hearing other singers and bands bring my songs to life. I believe a good song can come across whether I'm playing it solo acoustic or a full band's rocking it out with electric guitar and a horn section. It's all about the melody, the lyrics, and communicating something true through music."

DISCOGRAPHY

(2014) A Place for Everyone – Sonia Tetlow
(2014) Songs from Hell's Hollow – Roxie Watson
(2012) Own Way Home – Sonia Tetlow
(2012) Reclamation of the Pie-Eyed Piper – Paul Sanchez and the Rolling Road Show
(2012) Of Milestones and Moon Pie – Roxie Watson
(2010) True Stories – Roxie Watson
(2008) Herman Put Down the Gun – Herman Put Down the Gun
(2006) From a Seed of Sand – Sonia Tetlow
(2005) Voodoo Shoppe – Cowboy Mouth
(2002) Swerve – STB
(2000) Spit - STB","isMobileFriendly":"false","image":{"jumbo":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atjmbo.jpg","width":960,"height":611},"jumbo1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atjmbo1.jpg","width":960,"height":540},"large":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atlg.jpg","width":300,"height":191},"large1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atlg1.jpg","width":300,"height":191},"medium":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atmd.jpg","width":200,"height":127},"medium1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atmd1.jpg","width":200,"height":127},"original":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-og.jpg","width":960,"height":611},"small":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atsm.jpg","width":100,"height":64},"small1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atsm1.jpg","width":100,"height":64},"square":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-sq.jpg","width":100,"height":100},"squareSmall":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-sqsm.jpg","width":60,"height":60},"xlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atxl.jpg","width":500,"height":318},"xlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atxl1.jpg","width":500,"height":318},"xxlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atxxl.jpg","width":650,"height":414},"xxlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/01/83/50/47-atxxl1.jpg","width":650,"height":414}},"youtubeVideos":[],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"","urlMySpace":"","urlFacebook":"","urlTwitter":"http://twitter.com/soniatetlow","twitterScreenName":"soniatetlow"}],"supports":[],"urlEventDetailsUrl":"http://www.ticketfly.com/event/1317147?utm_medium=api"}]}
